business.headline: Why India's insurance market has become a breeding ground for mis-sellingFrom loans tied to unwanted policies to agents chasing fat commissions, insurance policies that were meant to shield families have instead become a trap for many.

Cryptocurrency a bigger challenge to dollar than BRICS currency, says WEF PresidentSpeaking in an exclusive conversation with India Today TV, Brende said de-dollarisation is unlikely in the near term. He added that cryptocurrency is a bigger challenge to the dollar than a potential BRICS currency.

India powers 18% of global growth, WEF chief sees tariff row with US easing soonIn an exclusive interaction with India Today TV, WEF President Borge Brende described India's rapid expansion as a source of "exported prosperity" to the world. "Just imagine what it means for global prosperity. So, you are exporting prosperity by growing so fast," he said.

A widow's wait, a worker's fight: The human struggle behind PF claimsIn Part 2 of our series on the PF claim crisis, we look at why, for so many Indians, withdrawing their own savings has turned into a struggle, forcing them to fight for money that is rightfully theirs.

Will October bring a market breakout? Earnings, GST price cuts fuel hopeAdani stocks led the rally on Thursday following Sebi's dismissal of Hindenburg Research allegations. Experts say this could mark the start of renewed market optimism.
Sensex, Nifty end lower amid profit booking; Adani Group shares gainThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 387.73 points to close at 82,626.23, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.55 points to settle at 25,327.05.

Explained: Why Intel shares jumped 22% after Nvidia's $5 billion investmentThe Nvidia-Intel deal not only fuels Intel's stock surge but strengthens its next-gen manufacturing and product integration, creating potential market shifts that could challenge competitors like AMD over the coming years.

Waiting for your ITR refund? Here is how to track itAfter filing your ITR, the next big question is, when will the refund come? Instead of guessing, you can quickly check the progress on the official portal.
Sensex tumbles 500 points: Is the stock market rally over?Around midday, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 471.67 points, settling at 82,542.29, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 130.20 points to 25,293.40.

Does the Income Tax Department delay refunds above Rs 50,000?With the ITR deadline now behind us, many taxpayers are anxiously waiting for their refunds. A common doubt is whether larger refunds, such as those above Rs 50,000, take longer to arrive.

New GST rates from September 22: Why you should double-check product MRPsConsumers must remain alert as new GST rates take effect September 22; checking MRPs carefully ensures savings are realised, avoiding overpayment due to old pricing or retailer confusion.

Adani Power in focus as Sebi clean chit sparks fresh rally in Adani Group stocksAdani Power's move stood out, as analysts see strong momentum beyond the short-term sentiment boost. Global brokerage Morgan Stanley has initiated coverage with an 'Overweight' rating and a target price of Rs 818 per share.

entertainment.headline: Bollywood's franchise fever: Why filmmakers keep chasing part twos and universesAre you a fan of franchises? Bollywood is hooked on them, banking on them and building universes for box-office wins. Experts from the industry shared why nothing but fresh storytelling can keep the magic alive.

Deepika shares emotional post on 6th collaboration with SRK after exit from Kalki 2Actor Deepika Padukone confirmed her role in Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'King' after leaving the 'Kalki 2989 AD sequel'. This move highlights ongoing industry shifts and creative disagreements in major film projects.

Zubeen Garg's final moments before scuba diving accident surface in viral videoAssamese singer Zubeen Garg died at the age of 52 following a scuba diving accident in Singapore. A video of him wearing a life jacket shortly before the tragedy has since gone viral online.

Kiss review: A cheesy romantic fantasy starring Kavin that tugs at your emotionsRelease Date:Fri Sep 19, 2025Kiss movie review: The Tamil film, written and directed by National award-winning choreographer Sathish Krishnan, stars Kavin and Preeti Israni in the lead. 'Kiss' is a breezy romantic film that is worth watching.

BIFF 2025 Day 3: Kim Da-mi, Dear X screening, and Lee Byung-hun headline BusanThe 30th Busan International Film Festival continued its vibrant run on day 3 with major premieres and star appearances. The event highlighted Netflix hits and exclusive reveals, promising an exciting festival ahead.

Homebound selection for Oscars 2026 a unanimous decision: Film Federation of IndiaThe Film Federation of India president, Firdausul Hasan reflected on 'Homebound' being selected as India's official entry for the 98th Academy Awards. In an exclusive interview with India Today, he stated that the film was unanimously selected by a 14-member jury.

Anurag Kashyap calls out Bollywood's toxicity, criticises AI in cinemaAnurag Kashyap criticised the "toxicity" in Bollywood and said the industry can never be united. He also slammed AI-generated cinema, calling it unethical and warning that actors will only unite when technology begins replacing them.

Homebound co-writer Sumit Roy expresses pride as film gets picked for Oscars 2026Director Neeraj Ghaywan's film 'Homebound' has been selected for the Oscars race. The film's co-writer Sumit Roy reacted to the news expressing pride on representing India globally.

Zubeen Garg, Assam's OG pop balladeer, and the question Gaane ki AaneZubeen Garg wasn't just a singer. He was the voice of Assam, weaving raw emotion into every note that defined generations. From the superhit Maya to intimate folk melodies, Zubeen left an indelible mark. He proved that true music transcends time and controversy.

Karan Johar calls Homebound a labour of love as film heads to Oscars 2026Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound', produced by Karan Johar, has been selected as India's official entry for Oscars 2026 in the Best International Feature category. Calling it a "labour of love," Johar expressed pride, while Ghaywan said representing India on a global stage was both "humbling and a matter of pride."

Rohit Saraf flaunts his abs in Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari song BTS picsRohit Saraf shared behind-the-scenes pictures from the new Holi song 'Panwadi' in his upcoming film 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari'.

Zubeen Garg's sister Jonkey Borthakur died in accident; tragedy shaped musicLife's cruel symmetry has played out for the Borthakur family, after Assam's pop star Zubeen Garg lost his life during a sea outing in Singapore. Twenty-three years ago, Zubeen's sister, Jonkey, met with a road accident that resulted in the death of the 20-year-old singer and actor. Her death in 2002 left young Zubeen devastated and shaped his music, spirit, and musical journey.

Neeraj Ghaywan's Homebound picked as India's official entry to OscarsDirector Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' has been selected as India's official entry for Oscars 2026. The film features Ishaan Khatter, Janhvi Kapoor and Vishal Jethwa in key roles.

Jr NTR injured during ad shoot, advised rest for few weeks: Official statementTelugu superstar Jr NTR suffered a minor injury while shooting an ad. His team confirmed he is stable, recovering well, and advised rest for a few weeks. Fans are urged not to speculate.

Zubeen Garg dies at 52: Fans pay tribute to Assamese icon's musical legacySinger Zubeen Garg died at 52 after a scuba diving accident in Singapore. Fans mourned his death while cherishing his music and contribution towards Assamese culture.

Apateu, Apateu! How a Korean drinking game became world's newest pop obsessionIn this week's K-fix, we discuss how Rose and Bruno Mars' 'APT.' turns a Korean drinking game into a viral anthem, uniting fans worldwide with its addictive chant and playful lyrics.

Lord Curzon Ki Haveli: Anshuman Jha's directorial debut hits theatres this OctoberThe much-awaited black comedy thriller 'Lord Curzon Ki Haveli', marking Anshuman Jha's directorial debut, is set to release in Indian theatres on October 10 after a successful international festival run.

Zubeen Garg dies at 52: Vishal Dadlani, Armaan Malik lead social media tributesThe sudden death of Zubeen Garg, the iconic Assamese singer and composer, has deeply saddened the music and film fraternity across India. Revered as the voice of Assam, his death was mourned by Vishal Dadlani, Pritam, Armaan Malik, among others.

Jolly LLB 3 X reviews: Akshay Kumar called content king by fansAkshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi-starrer 'Jolly LLB 3' was released in theatres today. The fans have been sharing their reviews on social media, calling Akshay the content king.

general news.headline: Soldier killed in gunfight in J&K, 4 suspected Jaish terrorists trappedA gunfight broke out in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district, where an Army soldier succumbed to his injuries and three to four suspected Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) terrorists were trapped by the security forces.

Trump signs order imposing $100,000 annual fee for H-1B visa applicationsUS President Donald Trump signed a proclamation imposing a $100,000 annual fee on H-1B visas, a sweeping overhaul expected to hit Indian workers hardest as they dominate approvals.

Saudi-Pak defence pact will change life for India, says Ian BremmerGeopolitical expert Ian Bremmer said Saudi Arabia's decision to sign a mutual defence pact with Pakistan will have far-reaching consequences for South Asia, particularly India.

Will Rahul Gandhi's Hydrogen Bomb explode on the Congress?Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's all-out campaign on 'vote chori' and the SIR exercise has raised eyebrows within his own party, with fears it could alienate allies and voters in Bihar. With Gandhi building up the "hydrogen bomb" hype, the Congress faces a dangerous gamble.

Trump unveils gold, platinum visas costing up to $5 million for US residencyDonald Trump launched Gold and Platinum visas, priced from $1 million to $5 million, offering wealthy foreigners residency benefits and citizenship pathways, predicting over $100 billion in revenue.

Pakistan says its nukes are available for Saudi Arabia under new defence pactPakistan's nuclear capabilities could be extended to Saudi Arabia under a new defence pact, Defence Minister Khawaja Asif said, in the first clear signal that Islamabad has placed Riyadh under its nuclear umbrella.

Mumbai to get India's largest cruise terminal today. Here's how it looksPM Modi will inaugurate Mumbai's International Cruise Terminal at Ballard Pier today, marking a major boost for India's maritime infrastructure, set to handle one million passengers annually and elevate the city as a premier global cruise tourism hub.

Super 4 preview: Can Pakistan prove they are second-best Asian team?India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka and Bangladesh have reached the Super 4 stage of the Asia Cup. India are the clear favourites to win the trophy. But who is the second-best side in the competition?

Preschool fees soar to lakhs: Are parents paying for toddler education or gloss?Over the past couple of years, viral posts have exposed the steep rise in preschool fees, with parents in cities like Bengaluru, Delhi and Jaipur paying lakhs per year. Once affordable neighbourhood playschools, today's preschools are big business, offering things like robotics kits and glossy facilities, leaving many middle-class families torn between aspiration and financial strain.

ULIPs & Mutual Funds: Why you need both for a balanced portfolioULIPs give you protection and discipline for the long haul, while mutual funds give you liquidity and flexibility for the near term.

Honda CB 125 Hornet review: Time for a Honda to shine againHonda has long played it safe with commuters, but the CB 125 Hornet flips the script. Sharp styling, street fighter stance, and modern features give it serious road presence. But is it more than just a pretty face? We find out.

How this drug is helping Kerala improve survival against brain-eating amoebaIn Kerala, doctors are now giving miltefosine along with standard medicines like amphotericin B as soon as they suspect symptoms of the deadly brain-eating amoeba.

Is US pushing India towards China with tariffs? What WEF chief Borge Brende saidWorld Economic Forum (WEF) President and CEO Borge Brende used the metaphor of panda and an elephant sharing a space to describe the India-China relationship.

Bomb threats to Delhi schools, including DPS Dwarka, students, staff evacuatedSeveral Delhi schools, including DPS Dwarka and Najafgarh schools, received bomb threats today; students and staff were safely evacuated as police and bomb squads conducted searches.

Picked from bus, made to drink urine: Man claims torture at police stationUttarakhand's top police official has transferred the Keshav Thalwal harassment case out of Tehri to ensure impartiality. The case has stirred controversy, with conflicting claims from Thalwal, the police, and his family.

sports.headline: Bangladesh eye revenge against Sri Lanka in Naagin rivalryBangladesh will seek revenge against Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup 2025 Super Four opener on September 20, aiming to rectify their earlier Group B loss and strengthen a fragile batting and bowling lineup.

Mentor Rohit, comedian Kohli: Yashasvi Jaiswal on Indian legendsYashasvi Jaiswal opened up on playing alongside Indian legends Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. While Jaiswal said that Rohit has been a mentor for him, he went on to reveal the funny side of Kohli in the dressing room.

Kuldeep Yadav can be India's Test X-factor: Anil Kumble after spinner's Asia Cup showAnil Kumble has backed Kuldeep Yadav to return to India's Test side, calling him the X-factor in the spin department. His Asia Cup form reinforces the spinner's potential to help India take 20 wickets in a match.

Shaheen Afridi needs Plan B ready for Shubman Gill: Wasim Akram before IND vs PAKWasim Akram has urged Shaheen Afridi to look beyond yorkers when Pakistan face India in the Asia Cup Super 4s. The Pakistan legend wants Afridi to keep a Plan B ready, especially against Shubman Gill.

Suryakumar Yadav snubs Pakistan again in post-match chat after beating OmanIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav once again snubbed Pakistan after their Asia Cup victory over Oman. Suryakumar refrained from taking Pakistan's name as hugged the opposing team's players after the match.

After snubbing Pakistan, India share warm hugs with Oman in Asia CupThe Indian cricket team shared warm hugs with Oman players after the conclusion of their final group-stage match of the Asia Cup. India captain Suryakumar Yadav spent some time with the Oman cricket team as well, sharing insights.

Arshdeep fastest pacer to 100 T20I wickets, overtakes Pakistan's Haris RaufIndia fast bowler Arshdeep Singh became the first India players to pick up 100 T20I wickets. Arshdeep made his T20I debut in 2022.

Experimental India survive Oman scare ahead of rematch vs PakistanAsia Cup 2025: India were fully focused on giving their untested batters and bowlers game time in their dead-rubber against Oman. Ahead of the Super 4s, India found answers in Abu Dhabi. Oman, meanwhile, walked away with the belief that they could trouble bigger teams.

Afridi has responded to Irfan Pathan's dog meat story and has publicly dismissed the former India player's claims. Afridi further added that he does not consider Irfan a real man.

Gautam Gambhir ensured nothing went wrong in Delhi's domestic team: Unmukt ChandUnmukt Chand praised Gautam Gambhir's leadership during his Delhi cricket tenure. He revealed internal politics led to his removal and expressed disappointment over team issues after Gambhir's retirement.

Forgetful like Rohit, selfless like Rohit: Suryakumar demotes himself to No. 11Asia Cup 2025: India captain Suryakumar Yadav skipped batting against Oman, giving the untested middle order valuable time in the middle. India posted 188 for 8 in Abu Dhabi, with Sanju Samson scoring a fifty.

Dunith Wellalage to rejoin Sri Lanka team after attending father's funeralSri Lanka spinner Dunith Wellalage will rejoin the national team after attending his late father's funeral. His father died during their fixture Asia Cup fixture against Afghanistan.

Noah Lyles emulates Usain Bolt with 4th 200m gold, historic double for MelissaWorld Athletics Championships: Noah Lyles matched Usain Bolt's record of four straight world 200m titles with a dramatic win on Friday. Melissa Jefferson-Wooden completed the sprint double in Tokyo, becoming the first American woman to do so at the world meet.

Shubman is another KL Rahul: Opener criticised after terrible showAsia Cup: India vice-captain Shubman Gill was slammed by the fans after a woeful knock against Oman. Shubman was bowled through the gates by Faisal Shah in the 2nd over.

India finally remember Arshdeep, hand him Asia Cup game vs OmanAsia Cup 2025: India finally gave a match to Arshdeep Singh ahead of their Super 4 fixtures in the Asia Cup. The team opted for a fresh bowling combination for their match against Oman.

I have become like Rohit: Suryakumar jokes after forgetting team changes at tossIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav forgot one of the team changes before the Asia Cup match against Oman, taking a light-hearted jibe at former skipper Rohit Sharma — well known for his trademark forgetfulness.

PCB responds, says ICC protocols allow media managers to use camerasPakistan Cricket Board has defended its media manager for filming a meeting with the ICC match referee Andy Pycroft before the Asia Cup game against UAE. ICC CEO Sanjog Gupta had written to the PCB citing "multiple violations" of the Players and Match Officials Area (PMOA) code.

Kuldeep Yadav and I grew up playing together: Oman batter recalls childhood memoriesOman's Vinayak Shukla is set for an emotional Asia Cup clash against India, where he will face his childhood friend Kuldeep Yadav. Despite Oman's early exit from the tournament, Shukla cherishes the chance to test himself against top sides like India and Pakistan.

Neeraj, Arshad vow strong comebacks after World Championships setbacksNeeraj Chopra and Arshad Nadeem faced disappointing results at the Tokyo World Athletics Championships. Chopra finished eighth with a best throw of 84.03 m while Nadeem finished tenth with a best throw of 82.75m.

Heartbreak for Gulveer in 5k, Annu Rani disappoints in javelinWorld Athletics Championships: India's Gulveer Singh failed to qualify for the men's 5000m final by a narrow margin. Meanwhile, javelin thrower Annu Rani also exited early after a disappointing qualifying performance.

Built like Arshad Nadeem, India's Sachin Yadav is tipped for Neeraj-like greatnessOnce a cricket-loving teenager from a small village, Sachin Yadav now competes with the world's best. After making a statement with a fourth-place finish at the Tokyo World Championships, the 25-year-old is being tipped for Olympic success in Los Angeles. His former coaches highlight what makes him special and why he draws comparisons to Pakistan's Olympic champion, Arshad Nadeem.

Marcus Rashford eager to extend Barcelona stay after Newcastle heroicsMarcus Rashford said that he is eager to extend his stay at Barcelona after scoring a brace against Newcastle United in the Champions League on Thursday, September 18. Rashford is currently on loan from Manchester United.

Arsenal boardroom shake-up: Tim Lewis departs, Richard Garlick becomes CEOArsenal's boardroom sees a major shift as Tim Lewis stepped down from his role with Richard Garlick getting promoted to the role of CEO.

After Dhruv Jurel, Devudutt Padikkal hits composed century vs Australia ADevdutt Padikkal's composed century against Australia A signals his return to form. With the West Indies Test squad announcement approaching, the Karnataka batter strengthens his case for a middle-order spot in India's red-ball setup.

Buoyed by record win, India eye historic series triumph before Women's World CupINDW vs AUSW: India women's cricket team is on the verge of a historic bilateral series win against Australia when the two teams meet on September 20 in New Delhi. The upcoming match could redefine the rivalry and boost India's confidence ahead of the Women's World Cup.

Day 7 Highlights: Noah Lyles wins 200m sprint, matches Usain BoltWorld Athletics Championships Day 7 Highlights: Noah Lyles wins the men's 200m sprint with devastating top-end sprint. He matches Usain Bolt with his 4th gold medal in the world championships. Olympic champion Letsile Tebogo finishes 4th.

Erling Haaland can break the UCL record of Cristiano Ronaldo: Pep GuardiolaPep Guardiola believes Erling Haaland has what it takes to one day eclipse Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi in Europe. The Manchester City striker just became the fastest to reach 50 Champions League goals, achieving it in 49 games.

Asia Cup 2025, Super 4s: Know India's full schedule in 2nd phase of tournamentIndia are all set to enter as favourites as the Super 4s of the Asia Cup 2025 is all set to begin from September 19. India will take on Pakistan, Bangladesh and Sri Lanka during the second phase of the tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
